body:
@spastorino I have the same problem as @mosinandrey here with navigation not re-highlighting after a POST (via a class in nav). I don't understand why we would be limiting current_page to just GET requests. Example scenario: localhost:3000/subscriptions user submits a form successfully current_page? returns false on re-render (to /subscriptions) Routes: ```ruby resource :subscriptions, only: [:edit, :update] get '/subscriptions' => 'subscriptions#edit' ``` Here's a quick hack for the current_page? method on a POST for anyone else coming across this. If your subscriptions page posts to /waffles, the below will re-highlight 'Subscriptions' in the nav. ```ruby def active_page(*path) "active" if current_page?(path.first) || path.include?(request.fullpath) end ``` ```
  • <%= link_to 'Subscriptions', subscriptions_path, class: active_page(subscriptions_path, waffles_path) %>
    • ```
